name: Ext.layout.ContextItem
doc:
This class manages state information for a component or element during a layout.

Blocks

A "block" is a required value that is preventing further calculation. When a layout has encountered a situation where it cannot possibly calculate results, it can associate itself with the context item and missing property so that it will not be rescheduled until that property is set.

Blocks are a one-shot registration. Once the property changes, the block is removed.

Be careful with blocks. If any further calculations can be made, a block is not the right choice.

Triggers

Whenever any call to getProp, getDomProp, hasProp or hasDomProp is made, the current layout is automatically registered as being dependent on that property in the appropriate state. Any changes to the property will trigger the layout and it will be queued in the Ext.layout.Context.

Triggers, once added, remain for the entire layout. Any changes to the property will reschedule all unfinished layouts in their trigger set.

members.name: dirtyCount
members.short_doc: The number of dirty properties ...

members.name: optOut
members.doc: There are several cases that allow us to skip (opt out) of laying out a component and its children as long as its lastBox is not marked as invalid. If anything happens to change things, the lastBox is marked as invalid by updateLayout as it ascends the component hierarchy.

There are several cases that allow us to skip (opt out) of laying out a component

members.name: state
members.doc: State variables that are cleared when invalidated. Only applies to component items.
members.short_doc: State variables that are cleared when invalidated. ...

members.name: styles
members.doc: Adds x and y values from a props object to a styles object as "left" and "top" values. Overridden to add the x property as "right" in rtl mode.A styles object for an Element

return.name: return
return.doc: count The number of styles that were set.

members.short_doc: Adds x and y values from a props object to a styles object as "left" and "top" values. ...

members.name: wrapsComponent
members.doc: True if this item wraps a Component (rather than an Element).
members.short_doc: True if this item wraps a Component (rather than an Element). ...

members.name: addBlock

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the block list ('blocks' or 'domBlocks').

params.name: layout
params.doc: The layout that is blocked.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name that blocked the layout (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Adds a block. ...

members.name: addTrigger

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name that triggers the layout (e.g., 'width').

params.name: inDom
params.doc: True if the trigger list is domTriggers, false if triggers.

members.short_doc: Adds a trigger. ...

members.name: block
members.doc: Registers a layout in the block list for the given property. Once the property is set in the Ext.layout.Context, the layout is unblocked.

params.name: layout
propName
params.doc: The property name that blocked the layout (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Registers a layout in the block list for the given property. ...

members.name: clearBlocks
members.doc: Removes any blocks on a property in the specified set. Any layouts that were blocked by this property and are not still blocked (by other properties) will be rescheduled.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the block list ('blocks' or 'domBlocks').

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name that blocked the layout (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Removes any blocks on a property in the specified set. ...

members.name: clearMarginCache
members.doc: clears the margin cache so that marginInfo get re-read from the dom on the next call to getMarginInfo() This is needed in some special cases where the margins have changed since the last layout, making the cached values invalid. For example collapsed window headers have different margin than expanded ones.
members.short_doc:
clears the margin cache so that marginInfo get re-read from the dom on the next call to getMarginInfo()
This is neede...

members.name: domBlock
members.doc: Registers a layout in the DOM block list for the given property. Once the property flushed to the DOM by the Ext.layout.Context, the layout is unblocked.

params.name: layout
propName
params.doc: The property name that blocked the layout (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Registers a layout in the DOM block list for the given property. ...

members.name: fireTriggers
members.doc: Reschedules any layouts associated with a given trigger.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the trigger list ('triggers' or 'domTriggers').

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name that triggers the layout (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Reschedules any layouts associated with a given trigger. ...

members.name: flush
members.doc: Flushes any updates in the dirty collection to the DOM. This is only called if there are dirty entries because this object is only added to the flushQueue of the Ext.layout.Context when entries become dirty.
members.short_doc: Flushes any updates in the dirty collection to the DOM. ...

members.name: getBorderInfo
members.doc: Gets the border information for the element as an object with left, top, right and bottom properties holding border size in pixels. This object is only read from the DOM on first request and is cached.
members.short_doc:
Gets the border information for the element as an object with left, top, right and
bottom properties holding border s...

members.name: getDomProp
members.doc: Gets a property of this object if it is correct in the DOM. Also tracks the current layout as dependent on this property so that DOM writes of it will trigger the layout to be recalculated.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name (e.g., 'width').

return.name: return
return.doc: The property value or undefined if not yet set or is dirty.

members.short_doc: Gets a property of this object if it is correct in the DOM. ...

members.name: getEl
members.doc: Returns the context item for an owned element. This should only be called on a component's item. The list of child items is used to manage invalidating calculated results.

params.name: nameOrEl
params.doc: The element or the name of an owned element

params.name: owner
params.doc: The owner of the named element if the passed "nameOrEl" parameter is a String. Defaults to this ContextItem's "target" property. For more details on owned elements see childEls and renderSelectors

members.short_doc: Returns the context item for an owned element. ...

members.name: getFrameInfo
members.doc: Gets the "frame" information for the element as an object with left, top, right and bottom properties holding border+framing size in pixels. This object is calculated on first request and is cached.
members.short_doc:
Gets the "frame" information for the element as an object with left, top, right and
bottom properties holding border+...

members.name: getMarginInfo
members.doc: Gets the margin information for the element as an object with left, top, right and bottom properties holding margin size in pixels. This object is only read from the DOM on first request and is cached.
members.short_doc:
Gets the margin information for the element as an object with left, top, right and
bottom properties holding margin s...

members.name: getPaddingInfo
members.doc: Gets the padding information for the element as an object with left, top, right and bottom properties holding padding size in pixels. This object is only read from the DOM on first request and is cached.
members.short_doc:
Gets the padding information for the element as an object with left, top, right and
bottom properties holding padding...

members.name: getProp
members.doc: Gets a property of this object. Also tracks the current layout as dependent on this property so that changes to it will trigger the layout to be recalculated.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name that blocked the layout (e.g., 'width').

return.name: return
return.doc: The property value or undefined if not yet set.

members.short_doc: Gets a property of this object. ...

members.name: getStyle
members.doc: Returns a style for this item. Each style is read from the DOM only once on first request and is then cached. If the value is an integer, it is parsed automatically (so '5px' is not returned, but rather 5).

params.name: styleName
params.doc: The CSS style name.

return.name: return
return.doc: The value of the DOM style (parsed as necessary).

members.short_doc: Returns a style for this item. ...

members.name: getStyles
members.doc: Returns styles for this item. Each style is read from the DOM only once on first request and is then cached. If the value is an integer, it is parsed automatically (so '5px' is not returned, but rather 5).

params.name: styleNames
params.doc: The CSS style names.

params.name: altNames
params.doc: The alternate names for the returned styles. If given, these names must correspond one-for-one to the styleNames.

return.name: return
return.doc: The values of the DOM styles (parsed as necessary).

members.short_doc: Returns styles for this item. ...

members.name: hasDomProp
members.doc: Returns true if the given property is correct in the DOM. This is equivalent to calling getDomProp and not getting an undefined result. In particular, this call registers the current layout to be triggered by flushes of this property.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Returns true if the given property is correct in the DOM. ...

members.name: hasProp
members.doc: Returns true if the given property has been set. This is equivalent to calling getProp and not getting an undefined result. In particular, this call registers the current layout to be triggered by changes to this property.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name (e.g., 'width').

members.short_doc: Returns true if the given property has been set. ...

members.name: init
members.doc: Clears all properties on this object except (perhaps) those not calculated by this component. This is more complex than it would seem because a layout can decide to invalidate its results and run the component's layouts again, but since some of the values may be calculated by the container, care must be taken to preserve those values.

params.name: full
params.doc: True if all properties are to be invalidated, false to keep those calculated by the ownerCt.

return.name: return
return.doc: A value to pass as the first argument to initContinue.

members.short_doc:
Clears all properties on this object except (perhaps) those not calculated by this
component. ...

members.name: invalidate
members.doc:
Invalidates the component associated with this item. The layouts for this component and all of its contained items will be re-run after first clearing any computed values.

If state needs to be carried forward beyond the invalidation, the options parameter can be used.

params.name: options
params.doc: An object describing how to handle the invalidation.

properties.name: state
properties.doc: An object to Ext.apply to the state of this item after invalidation clears all other properties.

properties.name: before
properties.doc: A function to call after the context data is cleared and before the Ext.layout.Layout.beginLayoutCycle methods are called.

properties.name: after
properties.doc: A function to call after the context data is cleared and after the Ext.layout.Layout.beginLayoutCycle methods are called.

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope to use when calling the callback functions.

members.short_doc: Invalidates the component associated with this item. ...

members.name: recoverProp
members.doc: Recovers a property value from the last computation and restores its value and dirty state.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The name of the property to recover.

params.name: oldProps
params.doc: The old "props" object from which to recover values.

params.name: oldDirty
params.doc: The old "dirty" object from which to recover state.

members.short_doc:
Recovers a property value from the last computation and restores its value and
dirty state. ...

members.name: removeEl
members.doc: Removes a cached ContextItem that was created using getEl. It may be necessary to call this method if the dom reference for owned element changes so that getEl can be called again to reinitialize the ContextItem with the new element.

params.name: nameOrEl
params.doc: The element or the name of an owned element

params.name: owner
params.doc: The owner of the named element if the passed "nameOrEl" parameter is a String. Defaults to this ContextItem's "target" property.

members.short_doc: Removes a cached ContextItem that was created using getEl. ...

members.name: setAttribute
members.doc: Queue the setting of a DOM attribute on this ContextItem's target when next flushed.
members.short_doc: Queue the setting of a DOM attribute on this ContextItem's target when next flushed. ...

members.name: setContentHeight
members.doc:
Sets the contentHeight property. If the component uses raw content, then only the measured height is acceptable.

Calculated values can sometimes be NaN or undefined, which generally mean the calculation is not done. To indicate that such as value was passed, 0 is returned. Otherwise, 1 is returned.

If the caller is not measuring (i.e., they are calculating) and the component has raw content, 1 is returned indicating that the caller is done.
members.short_doc: Sets the contentHeight property. ...

members.name: setContentSize
members.doc:
Sets the contentWidth and contentHeight properties. If the component uses raw content, then only the measured values are acceptable.

Calculated values can sometimes be NaN or undefined, which generally means that the calculation is not done. To indicate that either passed value was such a value, false returned. Otherwise, true is returned.

If the caller is not measuring (i.e., they are calculating) and the component has raw content, true is returned indicating that the caller is done.
members.short_doc: Sets the contentWidth and contentHeight properties. ...

members.name: setContentWidth
members.doc:
Sets the contentWidth property. If the component uses raw content, then only the measured width is acceptable.

Calculated values can sometimes be NaN or undefined, which generally means that the calculation is not done. To indicate that such as value was passed, 0 is returned. Otherwise, 1 is returned.

If the caller is not measuring (i.e., they are calculating) and the component has raw content, 1 is returned indicating that the caller is done.
members.short_doc: Sets the contentWidth property. ...

members.name: setHeight
members.doc: Sets the height and constrains the height to min/maxHeight range.

params.name: height
params.doc: The height.

params.name: dirty
params.doc: Specifies if the value is currently in the DOM. A value of false indicates that the value is already in the DOM.

members.short_doc: Sets the height and constrains the height to min/maxHeight range. ...

members.name: setProp
members.doc: Sets a property value. This will unblock and/or trigger dependent layouts if the property value is being changed. Values of NaN and undefined are not accepted by this method.

params.name: propName
params.doc: The property name (e.g., 'width').

params.name: value
params.doc: The new value of the property.

params.name: dirty
params.doc: Optionally specifies if the value is currently in the DOM (default is true which indicates the value is not in the DOM and must be flushed at some point).

return.name: return
return.doc: 1 if this call specified the property value, 0 if not.

members.short_doc: Sets a property value. ...

members.name: setWidth
members.doc: Sets the height and constrains the width to min/maxWidth range.

params.name: width
params.doc: The width.

params.name: dirty
params.doc: Specifies if the value is currently in the DOM. A value of false indicates that the value is already in the DOM.

members.short_doc: Sets the height and constrains the width to min/maxWidth range. ...

short_doc: This class manages state information for a component or element during a layout. ...
